categories.name: expert
categories.description: an expert of the subject discussed in the document, therefore he asks complex questions.

categories.name: common person
categories.description: a common person who is not expert of the subject discussed in the document, therefore he asks basic questions.

categories.name: prefers_conciseness
categories.description: Asks very direct questions, uses keywords, implies need for a quick fact or definition.

categories.name: prefers_explanation
categories.description: Asks 'why' or 'how', requests details, implies need for understanding.

categories.name: prefers_list_or_steps
categories.description: Asks for examples, types, methods, or instructions.

categories.name: prefers_structured_data
categories.description: Asks for comparisons, tables, pros/cons (often implicitly).

categories.name: information_seeking
categories.description: User primarily wants to know a fact or understand a topic.

categories.name: instructional
categories.description: User is asking the system to perform a task (e.g., 'summarize', 'translate', 'write code').

categories.name: comparison_seeking
categories.description: User wants to understand the similarities or differences between two or more things.

categories.name: opinion_seeking
categories.description: User is asking for a subjective viewpoint or recommendation (may require careful handling).

categories.name: native_fluent
categories.description: Uses language idiomatically and without significant grammatical errors.

categories.name: non_native_learner
categories.description: Shows signs of language learning (simpler sentences, grammatical errors, direct translations).

categories.name: formal
categories.description: Uses formal language, complete sentences, proper grammar, avoids slang.

categories.name: neutral_polite
categories.description: Uses generally correct language, may include polite phrasing ('please', 'thank you').

categories.name: informal_casual
categories.description: Uses conversational language, abbreviations, slang, sentence fragments, emojis.

categories.name: work_professional
categories.description: Query related to job tasks, industry knowledge, professional development.

categories.name: academic_learning
categories.description: Query related to school, homework, research, understanding complex topics.

categories.name: personal_interest_hobby
categories.description: Query driven by curiosity, entertainment, hobbies, or general knowledge.

categories.name: practical_need_problem_solving
categories.description: Query aimed at solving an immediate practical problem (e.g., how-to, troubleshooting, travel planning).

categories.name: neutral
categories.description: Query is objective and doesn't show strong emotional indicators.

categories.name: positive_curious
categories.description: Query shows enthusiasm, curiosity, or positive framing.

categories.name: negative_frustrated
categories.description: Query expresses frustration, urgency, confusion, or negative sentiment.

categories.name: prefers_conciseness
categories.description: Asks very direct questions, uses keywords, implies need for a quick fact or definition.

categories.name: prefers_explanation
categories.description: Asks 'why' or 'how', requests details, implies need for understanding.

categories.name: prefers_list_or_steps
categories.description: Asks for examples, types, methods, or instructions.

categories.name: prefers_structured_data
categories.description: Asks for comparisons, tables, pros/cons (often implicitly).

categories.name: likely_follow_up
categories.description: Question is open-ended, part of a larger topic, or invites further questions.

categories.name: moderate_follow_up
categories.description: Question could lead to follow-ups but is relatively self-contained.

categories.name: unlikely_follow_up
categories.description: Question is very specific, likely seeking a single piece of information (factoid, definition).

categories.name: highly_specific
categories.description: User clearly defines entities, constraints, and desired output.

categories.name: moderately_specific
categories.description: User gives a general idea but leaves room for interpretation or system discretion.

categories.name: vague_or_ambiguous
categories.description: User's request is unclear, overly broad, or could be interpreted in multiple ways.

categories.name: familiar_with_domain
categories.description: Uses specific terminology correctly, asks nuanced questions within a field.

categories.name: aware_of_domain
categories.description: Knows the general topic but asks more introductory or explanatory questions.

categories.name: unfamiliar_with_domain
categories.description: Asks very basic, high-level questions; may seem new to the subject area.

categories.name: transactional
categories.description: User focuses purely on the query and answer, minimal conversational filler.

categories.name: conversational
categories.description: User includes greetings, pleasantries, or more natural language framing around the query.

categories.name: directive
categories.description: User phrases requests as commands or instructions.

categories.name: prefers_examples
categories.description: User asks for 'examples', 'like what', 'such as'.

categories.name: prefers_definitions_theory
categories.description: User asks 'what is', 'explain', 'define', focuses on understanding concepts.

categories.name: prefers_practical_steps
categories.description: User asks 'how to', 'steps for', focuses on process.

categories.name: prefers_comparisons
categories.description: User asks 'difference between', 'compare', 'pros and cons'.
